citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The licensee sent a written itinerary for an exhibit at the Minnesota Renaissance Festival located in Shakopee, MN to the
Deputy Administrator on August 4, 2024. The itinerary submitted described the travel route to Shakopee, MN for two
camels and three African elephants, Paige, Genie, and Krissy. The itinerary submitted did not include the dates the
animals will be exhibited at the festival, nor the duration of their stay in Shakopee, MN, nor subsequent travel and/or
locations after their stay in Shakopee, MN, other than the licensee's home site.
The licensee must submit a written itinerary to the Deputy Administrator when exhibiting any animal longer than overnight
at any location other than the approved home site. The itinerary shall include all information required in this section, but
not limited to, the names, dates, and locations (with addresses) where the animals will travel, be housed, and be
exhibited, including all anticipated dates and locations (with addresses) for any stops and layovers that allow or require
removal of the animals from the transport enclosures.
Include all required information on itineraries for overnight travel. Failure to provide and update itinerary information
results in the Department's inability to conduct an inspection to ensure the welfare of the animals covered under the
Animal Welfare Act.
Correct by September 23, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.126(c)(1)(iii)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The licensee sent a written itinerary for an exhibit at the Minnesota Renaissance Festival located in Shakopee, MN to the

animals will be exhibited at the festival, nor the duration of their stay in Shakopee, MN, nor subsequent travel and/or 
locations after their stay in Shakopee, MN, other than the licensee's home site. 
 
The licensee must submit a written itinerary to the Deputy Administrator when exhibiting any animal longer than overnight 
at any location other than the approved home site. The itinerary shall include all information required in this section, but 
not limited to, the names, dates, and locations (with addresses) where the animals will travel, be housed, and be 
exhibited, including all anticipated dates and locations (with addresses) for any stops and layovers that allow or require 
removal of the animals from the transport enclosures. 
 
Include all required information on itineraries for overnight travel. Failure to provide and update itinerary information 
results in the Department's inability to conduct an inspection to ensure the welfare of the animals covered under the 
Animal Welfare Act. 
 
Correct by September 23, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
